channel.title: Oculus Rift
channel.description:
Hallo, the new source sdk makes hl2 compatible to the oculus rift. Is it possible to compile this beautifully mod with the sdk 2013 - to make it compatible to the rift ? PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE !!!
thank you very much
best regards - FR3D

item.title: Oculus Rift
item.dc:creator: drifterVR
item.description:
Hi people (and congrats to the team for this great remake)
The Hydra “mod” for HL² VR is out now (well, not technically a mod but a new game using the SDK 2013) and I must say it’s mind-blowing, best game experience so far for some old gamers (including me).
Now I understand that Black Mesa in native VR is a lot of work (and not a funny work), I just hope the team will find one day the motivation (and the time !)
Let’s wait for the riftmania (sometime in 2014 for the consumer version)

item.title: Oculus Rift
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
To each their own, I guess. As I said, they have different code bases. Porting the code isn’t as simple as you’d think; there’d be different functions inside of the code in some cases once they port over making old ones obsolete and they need to fix a shit load of bugs that would present themselves after the port to even have a workable client.

And I know. I’m not sure if you can use the Rift with the game itself, but I THINK you can run a client while the software runs in the background. It’s just that you won’t have the full feature list available. But again, I’m not entirely sure.

FYI it was a legitimate question, the community would’ve torn you a new one if it was a stupid one.

Read full topic

item.title: Oculus Rift
item.dc:creator: FR3D
item.description:
Chickenprotector:

Short answer, no.

Long answer, converting the code base will take A LOT of work. It just isn’t feasible with the team and free time they have. They have lives too, you know.

Oh - i understand sorry - it was just a question …

I love this mod too

https://cinematicmod.com/

https://cinematicmod.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=26&t=2309

This guy is ongoing with porting his cinematic mod to sdk 2013 - and as i understood the adding of the oculus rift + hydra support is/was no problem there ?

playing HL2 with the oculus rift is better than everything i’ve seen so far - it’s like you are really there …
a oculus rift ready black mesa would have been another milestone in gaming …

sorry for my stupid question

best regards FR3D
